A <FI>good<Fi> name <FI>is<Fi> rather to be chosen than great riches, <FI>and<Fi> loving favour rather than silver and gold.<RF>loving…: or, favour is better than, etc<Rf><CM>
The rich and poor meet together: the LORD <FI>is<Fi> the maker of them all.<CM>
A prudent <FI>man<Fi> foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.<CM>
By humility <FI>and<Fi> the fear of the LORD <FI>are<Fi> riches, and honour, and life.<RF>By…: or, The reward of humility, etc<Rf><CM>
Thorns <FI>and<Fi> snares <FI>are<Fi> in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.<CM>
Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.<RF>Train…: or, Catechise<Rf><RF>in…: Heb. in his way<Rf><CM>
The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower <FI>is<Fi> servant to the lender.<RF>the lender: Heb. the man that lendeth<Rf><CM>
He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.<RF>the rod…: or, with the rod of his anger he shall be consumed<Rf><CM>
He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.<RF>He that…: Heb. Good of eye<Rf><CM>
Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.<CM>
He that loveth pureness of heart, <FI>for<Fi> the grace of his lips the king <FI>shall be<Fi> his friend.<RF>for…: or, and hath grace in his lips<Rf><CM>
The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.<RF>the words: or, the matters<Rf><CM>
The slothful <FI>man<Fi> saith, <FI>There is<Fi> a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.<CM>
The mouth of strange women <FI>is<Fi> a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.<CM>
Foolishness <FI>is<Fi> bound in the heart of a child; <FI>but<Fi> the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.<CM>
He that oppresseth the poor to increase his <FI>riches, and<Fi> he that giveth to the rich, <FI>shall<Fi> surely <FI>come<Fi> to want.<CM>
Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
For <FI>it is<Fi> a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.<RF>within…: Heb. in thy belly<Rf>
That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.<RF>even…: or, trust thou also<Rf>
Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,
That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?<RF>to them…: or, to those that send thee?<Rf><CM>
Rob not the poor, because he <FI>is<Fi> poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.<CM>
Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.<CM>
Be not thou <FI>one<Fi> of them that strike hands, <FI>or<Fi> of them that are sureties for debts.
If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?<CM>
Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.<RF>landmark: or, bound<Rf><CM>
Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean <FI>men<Fi>.<RF>mean…: Heb. obscure men<Rf><CM>
